metadata.case_name: Appellant (Plaintiff) v. Ex-Ruler of Jaipur State & Ors.

facts.text: Goods supplied in the year 1947 to the Ruler of Jaipur State.
Refusal of the defendants to take delivery of some other goods similarly ordered.
Suit filed by the appellant for recovery of Rs. 23,998-12-0 as price of goods supplied, including interest and damages.
Defendants joined: ex-Ruler of Jaipur, his Military Secretary (second defendant), and Mohabat Singh (employee of ex-Ruler), on plea that they placed orders as agents.
ex-Ruler raised plea that suit incompetent without consent of Central Government under s. 87-B CPC.
Other defendants denied claim and liability on various grounds.
Military Secretary (second defendant) has since died; appeal not directed against him.
Suit filed prior to enactment of s. 87-B by s. 12 of Code of Civil Procedure Amendment Act, 1951 (II of 1951).
Subordinate Judge held suit cannot be continued against ex-Ruler without consent; adjourned hearing for four months to obtain consent.
Appellant applied to Central Government for consent; refused.
Appellant applied in revision contending s. 87-B offends Art. 14; Judicial Commissioner rejected.
Judicial Commissioner refused certificate under Art. 132(1).
Suit dismissed against all defendants: against ex-Ruler no consent; against others protected by s. 230 Indian Contract Act; s. 230(3) inapplicable.
Appeal to Judicial Commissioner, Ajmer, dismissed.
Certificate granted by High Court of Rajasthan under Arts. 132(1) and 133(1)(c) after Reorganisation of States.
Mohabat Singh signed letters purporting to emanate from Military Secretary; performing ministerial act.

legal_issues.text: Whether dismissal of suit against ex-Ruler erroneous: s. 87-B CPC ultra vires Art. 14, or inapplicable to pending suit.
Whether Mohabat Singh liable as agent or sub-agent under s. 230(3) Indian Contract Act.

petitioner_arguments.text: s. 87-B CPC ultra vires Constitution in view of Art. 14; discriminates in favour of ex-Rulers by creating immunity.
Even if valid, s. 87-B not applicable to pending suit; right to continue suit is substantive right, cannot be taken away without express words or necessary intendment.
Mohabat Singh liable as agent or sub-agent.

respondent_arguments.text: Suit incompetent against ex-Ruler without consent of Central Government under s. 87-B CPC.
Denied claim and liability on various grounds.

court_reasoning.text: ex-Rulers form a class based on historical considerations; special legislation justified as they handed over States in return for privileges; classification real and substantial.
court_reasoning.key_observation: s. 87-B not discriminatory under Art. 14; arises from classification based on historical facts.

court_reasoning.text: Word 'sued' in s. 86(1) CPC read with s. 87-B includes not only initiation but continuation of suit; consent necessary for pending suits.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Language of sufficient width to include pending actions.

court_reasoning.text: Mohabat Singh not agent of ex-Ruler; merely signed letters for Military Secretary as ministerial act.

holdings.text: s. 87-B CPC not ultra vires Art. 14; applies to pending suits; suit incompetent against ex-Ruler without consent.
Mohabat Singh not liable as agent; protected under s. 230 Indian Contract Act.

precedents_cited.relevance: Principles on retrospectivity of laws affecting pending cases.

precedents_cited.case_name: Garikapatti Veeraya v. N. Subbiah Choudhury
precedents_cited.relevance: On whether substantive rights affected in pending actions.

precedents_cited.case_name: K. C. Mukherjee v. Mst. Ram Ratan Kuer
precedents_cited.relevance: Language rebutting presumption against affecting vested rights.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Civil Procedure
statutes_cited.relevance: Provisions on suits against Rulers; consent required; applies to former Indian States.

statutes_cited.name: Indian Contract Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Protection to agents of ex-Ruler; s. 230(3) inapplicable.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Art. 14 equality; Art. 362 guarantees to Rulers; certificates for appeal.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Civil Procedure Amendment Act, 1951

outcome.summary: Appeal dismissed; suit incompetent against ex-Ruler without Central Government consent under s. 87-B CPC, which is valid and applies to pending suits; Mohabat Singh not liable as agent.

key_quotes.text: "The word sued means not only the filing of a suit or a civil proceeding but also their pursuit through Courts."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Interprets scope of s. 86(1) and s. 87-B to include continuation of pending suits.

key_quotes.text: "ex-Rulers form a class and the special legislation is based upon historical considerations applicable to them as a class."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "The privilege of ex-territoriality and exemption from civil jurisdiction except with the consent of the Central Government was one of long standing."
key_quotes.speaker: court
